title: Exolaunch Awarded First European Space Agency Launch Contract
summary:
German payload aggregator and in-space logistics company Exolaunch has been awarded a contract to launch the European Space Agency’s (ESA) Arctic Weather Satellite (AWS). In addition to being the first ESA launch contract awarded to the Berlin-based company, the awarding also marks a significant milestone for the agency as the first launch contract awarded through […]
The post Exolaunch Awarded First European Space Agency Launch Contract appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA Earth science mission once slated for cancellation ready for launch
summary: A nearly billion-dollar mission to study the Earth’s oceans and atmosphere is ready to launch after surviving several cancellation attempts earlier in its development.

title: China launches 20 satellites on separate inland and sea rocket launches
summary: A pair of Chinese rockets launched 11 mobility services satellites for an automaker and nine further, diverse satellites into orbit late Friday.

title: Inland spaceports seek ways to host orbital launches
summary: With congestion growing at the nation’s major launch sites in California and Florida, operators of inland spaceports are seeking creative ways to host orbital launches.
